acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.7mg/L of fishes (Bluegill) (HSDB, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since rabbit percutaneous LD50 value was 20mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)), it was set as Category 1.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It cannot taxonomic according to lack of information. The information on RTECS (2004) is not clear in a chemical exposure forms. (a dust, cracked gas)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: The steam pressure at normal temperature (1 Pa) is less than rat inhalation LC50 (37mg/m3) (RTECS (2004)).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 2 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 45mg/kg;  REFERENCE SOURCE: DFGOT vol.20 (2003)

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was judged with A4 by ACGIH, it was set as "Outside of Category."

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, not rapidly degrading (direct measurement (HPLC): 1% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow<=0.3 (existing chemical safety inspections data).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although there is information that it corrodes aluminum strongly, there is no experimental data of the metal corrosion rate. It is not classified into a class 8 according to UNRTDG, either.

explosives.rationale: Not classified in UNRTDG Class: 1 and Subsidiary risks Class, though containing azido groups.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Individual literature citations vary about a flammable. The data with tests defined by the United Nations is not found. It is not classified into the United Nations class 4.1.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale:
Although there are positive results from in vitro microbial mutagenicity tests, the in vitro mutagenicity tests in mammalian cells are negative and also there are no data from in vivo tests in mammals. So it was decided that the substance "could not be classified". It is considered that the strong mutagenicity is peculiar to microorganisms and plants. (DFGOT vol.20 (2003))
Category 2, which was based on the in vivo results in muscids, was also suggested in some comments from the experts, but in the end it was concluded that the substance could not be classified.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: With no sufficient information about causing sensitivity.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Not classified in UNRTDG Class: 4.1, but Class: 6.1 (though containing azido groups)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Since skin corrosivity was Category 1C, the eye was also set to "category 1."

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It judged to be "Category 1C" from corrosivity in animal test result and 4 hour contact (DFGOT vol.20 (2003)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: With no sufficient information about causing sensitivity.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Hydrogen azide is not generated when it melts in neutral waters.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (circulatory system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since increased sensitivity was seen in some patients when it was used for treatment for high blood pressure for humans over a long-term (ACGIH (2001)) , and the effects on the liver was seen with the given dose below 10mg/kg-day in an animal experiments, it was classified in "Category 1."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since there is a large number of examples about hypotension (be used as therapeutic agents) and suspected the side effects to its respiratory organs, digestive organ, etc. So it was classified into "Category 1."
